data.title: Wikiwand articles
data.meta_description: WMYJ is a radio station licensed to Martinsville, Indiana, United States. The station is owned by Mid-America Radio Group and broadcasts an Adult contemporary f...
data.text:
The station went on the air as WMCB on August 23, 1982. On October 23, 2005, the station changed its call sign to WSKT, and on November 29, 2005, to the current WMYJ.[4]

According to filings with the FCC, the station transmitter site was flooded by 8Â½ feet of water in June 2008, and FCC granted approval to suspend operations pending replacement of equipment. The station returned to the air in September 2008, and shortly afterward added 24-hour FM service via a translator at 94.1 FM, formerly a local relay for the K-Love network.

The station now airs an adult contemporary format.
